reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Penn's View Hotel was awesome. The service and staff were excellent and views of Penn's Landing were great. This hotel is in the perfect place to visit and see the history of Philadelphia. The attractions are right outside the door. The bar was fantastic and so was the breakfast. The room was just as the website described and much more sound proof than expected. We both had a good night sleep and really enjoyed our room. I would recommend taking a Sunset sail cruise about 3 blocks away (American Sailing Tours) and if you like adventure try the Detour Segway tour through Philadelphia, both were very fun and exciting.
reviews.title: Philadelphia, PA

reviews.text: The only disappointment was the parking for the hotel. It was packed and we paid $43.00 dollars a night. I would have though the Hotel would have picked up this voucher, but the price of the room was very reasonable, we were just not use to staying in a large city with this type of parking arrangement.
reviews.title: Will be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was on the list of hotels within walking distance of the office where I worked this week. The extra bonus here is that it's also a short walk to many restaurants and historic attractions such as the liberty bell. Aside from the great location, the hotel itself is not generic like a chain hotel, it has character and a comfortable, warm feeling. The room itself was adequate size with lovely hardwood floors and a well renovated, very clean bathroom with a tub.
reviews.title: Paris In Philadephia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar area reminded me of something from a old time Cary Grant movie (minus the cigarettes). It was dark, cozy and definitely inviting. If I lived nearby I could see this being a favorite spot for dinner with friends.
reviews.title: Lovely!

reviews.text: I asked for a quite room and was placed in an "interior" type room, which still has a window, but is buffered from the exterior of the building due to the layout. I could still hear faint traffic noise as there is a busy highway nearby, but it was minimal. The bed was fine, a little hard for my taste, but not a problem.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.text: This was the worst hotel I ever stayed at. Penn's View Hotel used to be shipping warehouse and is located next to the 95 freeways. You can hear constant traffic all night long. The walls and ceiling are also paper thin, so with the hardwood floors, my room was vibrating from all the stomping. I could hear everything the people were saying next door to me and outside the hall with my door closed. I asked for a quiet room, and all the manager could offer was a nonstandard room (I believed it was a used for the housekeepers' quarters-which looked nothing like the pictures of the room I paid for). Don't be deceived by the charming photos of the hotel and rooms. There is nothing quiet or charming about this "hostel."
reviews.title: NOISY!!! More like a hostel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before arriving at Penn's View (by shuttle), we dropped people off at several large, Center City hotels, all very predictable. How nice to arrive at this small-ish, nicely decorated haven next to the Delaware river, where our room on the 5th floor had a fireplace, a jacuzzi, and plenty of quiet comfort. Be advised that Penn's View is also situated next to I-95, but the double-paned windows and thick walls make you forget that unfortunate proximity. The staff is attentive and obliging, the restaurant is deliciously indulgent, and the speciality cocktails definitely worth sampling. Location: easy walking distance to all kinds of restaurants & to the wonderful SEPTA buses at 5th & Market (easy ride to museums), which is also the hub for Independence Park. We will definitely stay here again next time we come to Philly.
reviews.title: A charming hideaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a weekend get away to see the Titantic exibit at the Franklin Institute. We were going to stay closer to the Institute and looked at places within walking distance but decided on Penn's View and were glad we did. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. We had to take a taxi to the Franklin Institute and the staff had one waiting for us when we arrived in the lobby. The rooms were very clean and spacious with great amenities. The location was great we were in walking distance to Independence Hall, the Liberty Bell and every thing "Old City" has to offer. They also have a great continental breakfast with hot and cold items and fresh baked goods. Over all this is a great place to stay and really don't have any negative comments.
reviews.title: Weekend Get Away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location. In the heart of old city which is vibrant until 2am. Subway right outside. Or walk down market street into town in a few minutes. Around the corner from Elphreths alley and less than 10 mins walk on the flat to Independence Park. Overall location is spot on.
reviews.title: Great location in Old City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amenities are great. Comfy room, hot shower, opening balcony door, iron, hair dryer, nice toiletries. Coffee on tap in take out cups all day in reception foc. Daily newspaper foc. Ice machines. Breakfast was good. Fresh fruit, eggs, waffles you cook yourself. Good coffee and OJ. We really enjoyed our breakfasts. The staff were all lovely. Not one let the team down. If I have to say anything bad about this place. The freeway could be considered noisy. We did not find it so but then we love the sound of the city. I would suggest you pack a pair of ear plugs if this is a problem for you because it's certainly not a reason to avoid coming here.
reviews.title: Penn's View Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here because it was close to the ferry which brought us to the S.Bank Center for a concert ...and..we wanted to walk to some historic sites, and have Market Street (next door) for restaurant choices. Penn's View Hotel was perfect for these reasons. The hotel was very "quaint", historic, clean, and comfortable. Highly recommend!
reviews.title: Perfect location...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very charming hotel. Room was adequate size. They have a nice continental breakfast. You can make your own waffles, eggs, toast,...besides the fruit and pastries. Excellent restaurant in the hotel as well. This facility is at the corner of Front St. and Market., Directly across the road is the Delaware River. Walk out the front door and you are within easy walking distance of a majority of the historic sites as well as many good restaurants and bars. We would stay at this hotel the next time we go back to Philly.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location if you want to walk around the historic district of Philadelphia. At first I was concerned by how close the hotel is to the highway, but the room was very quiet. Take advantage of the "happy hour" special in the restaurant. The wine selection is truly amazing.
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.text: I was returning to my hometown of Phildelphia to attend a reunion of one of the branches of my family. I decided to check TripAdvisor for listings of hotels to see which were the closest to the reunion site. The hall was in a residential area of the city so I looked downtown. I chose the Penn's View Hotel because it was the closest to Interstate 95, the Riverfront, Penn's Landing and Olde City Philadelphia. I was not disappointed.
reviews.title: Short Visit Home for a Family Reunion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I came into the city from the south using I-95 and the Penn's View was easy to find. The hotel faces the Delaware River. There is a private parking lot next door not affiliated with the hotel that was miore than convenient and charged $23 a day (in and out); a good fee for the center of a big city. In just a few steps I was in the small lobby and checked in quickly. I took the slooooow elevator to the 2nd floor.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel - Could Use Improvement in Customer Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are wanting to be in the 'Old City' area of Philadelphia then consider the Penn's View Hotel.
reviews.title: A gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are welcoming with an eclectic decorating look, they are clean and spacious. Prices at Penn's View are modest (and don't forget the complimentary breakfast). Staff is helpful and friendly. If this were not enough reason stay at Penn's View; the inviting Bar adds to the draw, with a serious nod to wine enjoyment the Bar boasts a 120 tap cruvinet system which allows you to have tastings from an enormous selection of wines without having to buy an entire bottle.
reviews.title: Quaint inexpensive beautiful view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Access to the historic Old City area made for a wonderful time away.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel!

reviews.text: Very quaint, historic, relatively inexpensive hotel on the waterfront with Penn's Landing view. Walking distance to great, restaurants and shopping. Attentive staff, above average attached restaurant.
reviews.title: Great Overnight Stay
Amazing hotel and staff
reviews.text: When I book a hotel in a new city I always try to find something with a little historic character that's in a neighborhood convenient to the tourist area. This hotel is exactly that - absolutely great location, within walking distance of all the Old City attractions and an endless number of restaurants with easy access to public transit. Our room was clean and quiet and the staff was helpful without being overbearing. Highly recommend.
